sections.heading: Mike West technical posts
sections.note: Original Type 2 mailing list write-ups from Mike West.

welding2.title: Hammer Welding (answer)
welding2.subject: [VB] Hammer Welding (answer)
welding2.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
welding2.description: Mike explains that “hammer welding” patch panels is really about controlling shrinkage: tack opposite corners, counter the pull with a dolly and hammer, and keep the crown before stitching the seam; he closes by describing true forge hammer welding.

welding1.title: Welding Type 1 Magnesium Case
welding1.subject: Welding Type 1 Magnesium Case
welding1.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
welding1.description: Field notes on using a Miller 185 with a spool gun to weld gussets into magnesium cases—test coupons, filler choices, preheat, and how “cold” welds snap by hand.

welding.title: Welding Stuff, mig, wire welder, brazing ..
welding.subject: Welding Stuff, mig, wire welder, brazing ..
welding.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
welding.description: A grab bag of welding hacks: running brazing wire in a MIG, feeding extra filler rod by hand, managing polarity, and dealing with magnetic arc blow while patching thin sheet.

torque.title: Re: RFC: Torque, and tools. and what not to do...
torque.subject: Re: RFC: Torque, and tools. and what not to do...
torque.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
torque.description: Explains the math for torque-wrench extensions, when crows-feet multiply torque, why socket extensions flex, and how careless cheater bars bend cranks.

cranks.title: Crankshaft, Flywheel, Weights
cranks.subject: Crankshaft, Flywheel, Weights
cranks.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
cranks.description: Weighs stock, counterweighted, and Type 4 cranks/flywheels, noting forging quality and what counterweights really cure (bending loads and harmonics).

cranks1.title: Crankshaft, general description
cranks1.subject: Crankshaft, general description
cranks1.author: mwest_at_cdsnet_dot_net (Mike West)
cranks1.description: Newbie primer on what the crankshaft does, where it sits between pulley and flywheel, and why line-boring keeps piston thrust aligned.

studs2.title: Re: Head studs jam, preheater pipe 'n rockers
studs2.subject: Re: head studs jam, preheater pipe 'n rockers
studs2.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
studs2.description: How to deal with head studs that back out, correct rocker locknut torque, and brutal but effective methods for clearing carbon from intake preheat pipes.

hrfi.title: Re: Hot-rodding the Fuel Injection
hrfi.subject: RE: Hot-rodding the Fuel Injection
hrfi.author: Will Wood <wkwood@burgoyne.com>
hrfi.description: Will Wood’s advice on Rabbit EFI swaps: keep factory sensors, budget for bigger injectors/pumps on boosted engines, and use intercoolers so air-cooled heads survive.

hfi.title: Hot-rodding the Fuel Injection
hfi.subject: Hot-rodding the Fuel Injection
hfi.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
hfi.description: Mike’s take that Bosch FI is just another carb with feedback—big gains come from a healthy long block and sensors, not gimmicks.

swft.title: re: Installing swvel foot adjusters
swft.subject: Re: [Fwd: installing swivel foot adjusters]
swft.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
swft.description: Installing Porsche-style swivel-foot adjusters: relieve the rocker, drill oil passages, shim stands for geometry, and keep the adjusters oiled.

carbon.title: Combustion Deposits, Cleaning of . . .
carbon.subject: Combustion Deposits, Cleaning of . . .
carbon.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
carbon.description: Defines combustion deposits on VW heads/pistons, how to scrape or bead-blast them safely, and why mixture/temperature control is the cure.

cv.title: C.V. Joints, The doin' of
cv.subject: C.V. Joints, The doin' of
cv.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
cv.description: Soup-to-nuts CV joint service: mark orientation, clean spotless, use moly grease, torque bolts correctly, and rotate joints intelligently.

vg.title: re: Help with valve geometry/lube!
vg.subject: Re: HELP with valve geometry/lube!
vg.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
vg.description: Diagnoses valve-geometry/lubrication issues, advising polished contact surfaces, proper shimming, and routed oil so high-lift cams stop chewing parts.

gasket.title: Making a Gasket
gasket.subject: Making a gasket
gasket.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
gasket.description: Shows how to make dependable paper/cork gaskets with adhesive, a ball-peen, and light oil so covers seal without store-bought gaskets.

valvesprings1.title: The Complete Lowdown on Valve Springs!
valvesprings1.subject: Re: Singleport vs. Dualport (Sunday! Sunday!)
valvesprings1.author: Will Wood <wkwood@burgoyne.com>
valvesprings1.description: Will Wood explains single vs. dual springs, measuring installed height/coil bind, and matching spring rates to cam profiles.

sump.title: Permatex and Sump plates (type 1)
sump.subject: Re: Query re: Permatex and Sump Plates [type I]
sump.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
sump.description: Stopping sump leaks: flatten the plate, face acorn nuts, glue paper gaskets with Aviation #3, and snug studs gently.

valvesprings.title: re: Valve springs
valvesprings.subject: Re: valve springs
valvesprings.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
valvesprings.description: Follow-up notes on shimming springs, matching ramp rates to pressure, and keeping installed pressures in the sweet spot.

random.title: Random . . stuff . .
random.subject: Random . . stuff . .
random.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
random.description: A grab bag of shop-floor wisdom, from improvised engine stands to Magnafluxing used cranks before reassembly.

rod.title: Straightness of a Rod
rod.subject: Re: Mike West - Straightness of rod..
rod.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
rod.description: How to check pushrods, cams, and cranks for runout using glass, V-blocks, and dial indicators, including VW wear limits.

stacks.title: Velocity Stacks
stacks.subject: Re: Velocity Stack question?
stacks.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
stacks.description: Justifies velocity stacks on dual carbs: smooths airflow and captures the fuel cloud hovering above the venturi for better mixture.

insert.title: Plug Insert Install
insert.subject: Plug insert install
insert.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
insert.description: Shows how to tap and Loctite a spark-plug insert with the engine still in the car: work the tap in slowly, clean chips off with cutting oil, lock the insert to a sacrificed plug, and let the epoxy cure before backing the plug out.

seat.title: Cheap Seat Rebuild
seat.subject: Cheap Seat Rebuild
seat.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
seat.description: Story and how-to on rebuilding front seats with carpet-store foam, salvaged scraps of naugahyde, and sailmaker needles, ending with firm seats for under $5 plus slip covers.

deck.title: How to measure deck height
deck.subject: Re: new rods or use my old ones
deck.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
deck.description: Explains cheap ways to check deck height and rod balance: use pipe spacers in place of the head, pull the jug down with nuts, lay a straightedge over the cylinder, and gauge clearance while verifying wrist-pin fits.

vtg4.title: Re: VTG, Rocker shims...
vtg4.subject: Re: VTG, Rocker Shims & Swivel Foots
vtg4.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
vtg4.description: Answers the follow-up question about shimming rocker shafts for swivel-foot adjusters—yes, expect longer pushrods or more screw extension, so plan geometry before final assembly.

vtg3.title: VTG, Rocker shims & swivel foots
vtg3.subject: VTG, Rocker Shims & Swivel Foots
vtg3.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
vtg3.description: Part two of the valve-train-geometry series describing how to shim rocker stands so the adjuster crosses the valve-stem center, why swivel feet help, and how to set each rocker before springs go on.

vtg2.title: VTG and rocker assembly II
vtg2.subject: VTG and the Rocker Assembly II
vtg2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
vtg2.description: Looks at the stock rocker box tolerances: offset rockers only spin two valves, springs and posts tie up the others, so geometry tweaks are needed before the adjuster will sweep the stems evenly.

pump.title: Full Flow Oil Pump
pump.subject: Full-flow oil pump
pump.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
pump.description: Walks through prepping a full-flow oil pump—plugging the stock outlet, grinding the housing to match the cover, lapping the cheap aluminum plate flat, and checking gear protrusion before plumbing the external filter.

airfilter.title: Oil Bath Air Filter vs Paper Filters
airfilter.subject: Re: Oil bath air filter / Paper Filter
airfilter.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
airfilter.description: Defends the VW oil-bath air cleaner by comparing it to a centrifuge: repeated right-angle turns and the oil trough fling dirt out of the airstream long before it reaches the carb throat.

mayo.title: Oil Cap mayonaise and beyond
mayo.subject: Oil cap mayonaise and beyond
mayo.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
mayo.description: Explains crankcase mayonaise: water from combustion and cold air condense inside unless the stock ventilation hoses pull a vacuum, which also boils off moisture, reduces leaks, and keeps the filler cap clean.

cam.title: Choosing a camshaft
cam.subject: Choosing a Cam Shaft
cam.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cam.description: Camshaft primer for a mild 1600: calculates CFM demand, references Bill Fisher’s data, talks gear ratios, and cautions that the rest of the combo (dual ports, exhaust, distributor) matters more than a wild cam.

valves5.title: Valve Train Lubrication
valves5.subject: Valve Train Lubrication
valves5.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
valves5.description: Describes the oil circuit through lifters, hollow pushrods, rocker shafts, and adjusters, and warns to keep tolerances tight and passages spotless because that oil is what cools the valves.

vtg.title: VTG and the camshaft connection
vtg.subject: VTG and the Camshaft connection
vtg.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
vtg.description: First installment of the VTG series: measuring cam lift to spot reground cams, understanding duration numbers, and treating the engine as a self-powered air compressor that needs accurate data.

zero.title: Re: 30W & zero temps & battery
zero.subject: Re: 30W & zero temps & battery
zero.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
zero.description: Cold-weather starting advice—check CCA and grounds, remember thick 30/40 weight acts like peanut butter at 0°F, and switch to multi-vis oil or pre-heat to ease cranking on a fresh rebuild.

fluff3.title: Non-sequitur VW fluff
fluff3.subject: Non-sequitur VW fluff
fluff3.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
fluff3.description: Diary entry from a parts run: $100 truck-stop oil changes, buying swivel feet at the ‘FLAPS’, and laughing at his brother’s poorly vented van that somehow still runs.

theory2.title: Re: Valve Train Geometry - Theory Meets Metal
theory2.subject: Re: Valve Train Geometry, Theory meets Metal
theory2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
theory2.description: Short note acknowledging the adjuster probably needs a slight offset and promising to run more tests before finishing the valve-geometry write-up.

nodark/other/theory.title: Re: Valev Train Geometry - Theory Meets Metal
nodark/other/theory.subject: Re: Valve Train Geometry, Theory meets M
nodark/other/theory.author: Robert King <rdking@mail.arc.nasa.gov>
nodark/other/theory.description: Robert King’s reply: rocker geometry should have the adjuster centered at half-lift and you fix it with rocker height or pushrod length—so check it any time the heads or case are machined.

theory.title: Valve Train Geometry - Theory Meets Metal
theory.subject: Valve Train Geometry, Theory meets Metal
theory.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
theory.description: Detailed look at rocker/valve alignment: measure stem height, shim or mill posts, use bluing and light springs to watch the adjuster sweep across the stem, and fix anything that isn’t centered.

tach.title: Dwell Meter/Tachometer, operation of
tach.subject: Dwell Meter/Tachometer, operation of.
tach.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
tach.description: Explains how to use a dwell/tach meter—from hooking up the leads, calibrating the gauge, checking points continuity, and reading rpm or dwell without being intimidated by the extra wires.

rust.title: Rust and Carbon, Solvent for...
rust.subject: Rust and Carbon, solvent for . . . .
rust.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
rust.description: Reveals the ‘military secret’ solvent for rust and carbon (hot water plus detergent), joking about sodium metasilicate but ultimately reminding us that heated soap-and-water baths melt rust better than miracle chemicals.

gauges.title: Gauges, Accuracy
gauges.subject: Gauges, Accuracy
gauges.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
gauges.description: Talks gauge accuracy: remote senders need a master gauge for calibration, best accuracy occurs near 60% of scale, and temperature senders can be checked in ice and boiling water.

heads5.title: CC'ing the Heads
heads5.subject: CC'ing the Heads
heads5.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads5.description: CC’ing heads properly—light grease, consistent pressure on the plexi plate, and reusing the same valves in each chamber can tighten volumes to within a quarter cc.

fluff2.title: Karma on Greyback fluff
fluff2.subject: Karma on Greyback fluff
fluff2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
fluff2.description: Another road story: helping stranded motorists, recounting a snowy climb up Greyback Mountain in a Beetle, and how easily the car slid into a ditch while chasing ‘VW karma’.

heads4.title: Re: Jug spacers and head alignment
heads4.subject: Re: Jug spacers and head alignment
heads4.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads4.description: Answers how much cylinder-height mismatch a head will tolerate (~.015 in), stresses pairing jugs of similar height, and warns that misalignment just warps the heads and wastes torque.

oilstuff.title: Re: Oil Stuff
oilstuff.subject: Re: oil stuff
oilstuff.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
oilstuff.description: Case-study from a reader who blew an oil galley plug in –12°F weather; Mike explains where the plugs hide, why 40-weight is useless in that cold, and suggests dropping the engine plus switching to thinner oil and proper warm-ups.

planes.title: V-Dub Airplanes fluff
planes.subject: V-dub Airplanes fluff
planes.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
planes.description: A fluff piece on visiting the Beagle Sky Ranch, spotting homebuilt planes running VW engines, and marveling at the ‘Jesus nut’ that keeps the prop’s gearbox hanging on.

heads3.title: Head heights on Ol' Thrasher
heads3.subject: Head heights on Ol'Thrasher
heads3.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads3.description: Logs the measurement of head heights on ‘Ol’ Thrasher’, showing how mismatched rods, spacers, and heads can vary by .012 in and why rebuilding with used parts is a patience test.

strobe.title: Using a strobe timing light
strobe.subject: Using a Srobe Timing Light
strobe.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
strobe.description: Hand-holding guide for using a strobe timing light: highlight the pulley notches, hook the inductive clamp to #1, power it up, warm the engine, and keep wires clear of rotating bits.

files.title: Files, metal, cutting, substitute
files.subject: Files, metal, cutting, substitute
files.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
files.description: Recommends abrasive belt sticks as modern replacements for flat files—cheap plastic holders with various grits that stay sharp and can reach tight spots without rusting.

jug.title: The Dummy Jug, Tool
jug.subject: The Dummy Jug, Tool
jug.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
jug.description: Defines the ‘dummy jug’—a sacrificial cylinder and piston used for lapping head sealing surfaces, checking deck heights, and test-fitting rods without scuffing new parts.

cfm.title: Carb CFM and Jet sizes (numbers)
cfm.subject: Carb CFM and Jet sizes (numbers)
cfm.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cfm.description: Provides drill-size equivalents for jet numbers and a formula (liters × rpm ÷ 56.64) to estimate carb CFM needs before you start hogging out jets.

air.title: Air leaks n' sutff
air.subject: Air Leaks n' stuff
air.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
air.description: Reminder that any air leak—pushrod tubes, valve stems, loose heads—upsets mixture, causes backfires, and overheating, so the whole engine must be sealed, not just the intake.

tap.title: Tapping holes by hand
tap.subject: Tapping holes by hand
tap.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
tap.description: How to hand-tap and install an exhaust-stud insert in situ: use an oiled plug tap, clean chips constantly, lock the insert to a sacrificial plug, glue it with Loctite, and let it cure before backing the plug out.

cats.title: Catalytic Converters
cats.subject: Catalytic Converters
cats.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cats.description: Explains how two-way and three-way catalytic converters use platinum, palladium, and rhodium plus oxygen to oxidize HC/CO and reduce NOx—and why unleaded fuel and closed-loop mixture control are mandatory.

points.title: Points and Dwell
points.subject: Points and Dwell
points.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
points.description: Points control dwell time; when they open the coil fires, so wrong gaps act like retarded/advanced timing and weak spark—set dwell with a meter, don’t just trust the feeler gauge.

nodark/other/cams2.title: Cam Sizes Error, long
nodark/other/cams2.subject: Cam Sizes Error, long
nodark/other/cams2.author: Tom David <fidsatom@mail.execpc.com>
nodark/other/cams2.description: Tom David retracts his ‘junk cam’ sizing tip: VW cam gears use involute contact, so worn flanks make gear numbers meaningless—use new gears and proper measuring instead.

valves4.title: Lapping the valves
valves4.subject: Lapping the Valves
valves4.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
valves4.description: Step-by-step valve lapping: strip the head, apply compound, spin the valve with a suction stick, clean, verify an even grey ring with layout blue, and repeat until each seat seals.

blowby.title: Crankcase ventilation & Blowby
blowby.subject: Crankcase ventilation & Blow-by
blowby.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
blowby.description: Crankcase ventilation discussion: VW designed slight vacuum through the pulley boot and breather; removing hoses or adding sand seals traps moisture, makes mayo, and blows oil.

cr.title: Balancing CR. Long n' Short Jugs
cr.subject: Balancing CR. Long n' short jugs
cr.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cr.description: Shows how pistons, rods, jugs, and spacers each vary a few thousandths; stacking them wisely keeps compression ratios balanced instead of letting tolerances pile up.

coil.title: The Coil n' Points, lightin' the fires
coil.subject: The Coil n' Points, lightin'the fires
coil.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
coil.description: Primer on the ignition coil: it’s a transformer that builds 20kV while the points are closed, dumps it when they open, and needs correct polarity, condensers, and supply voltage to avoid misfire.

spades.title: RK Electronics, pumping your spades
spades.subject: RK Electronics, pumping your spades
spades.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
spades.description: A cautionary tale about corroded power-strip sockets: moisture and temperature swings plate connectors just like dirty spade lugs on a car, so clean and tighten them if electrons misbehave.

pisbal2.title: More on Piston Balancing
pisbal2.subject: More on balancing Pistons
pisbal2.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
pisbal2.description: Real-world piston balancing: some Mahle slugs were 130 grains overweight, so Mike spent hours drilling and rasping nubs—plan time because some sets aren’t simple scraper jobs.

wire2.title: Re: Wire Ampacities
wire2.subject: Re: Wire Ampacities and Kirchoff
wire2.author: Jeff Diebolt <jdiebolt@UP.NET>
wire2.description: Jeff Diebolt translates metric wire sizes to AWG, listing circular-mil areas and a quick rule of thumb (10 ga ≈30A, 12 ga ≈20A, etc.) so repairs aren’t undersized.

wire.title: Wire Ampacities and Kirchoff
wire.subject: Wire Ampacities and Kirchoff
wire.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
wire.description: Intro to wire ampacity: VW diagrams list wire mm²; Mike gives approximate amp limits, jokes about midnight wiper fixes, and reminds us that fuses should match wire, not fashion.

pisbal.title: Balancing Pistons
pisbal.subject: Balancing Pistons etc.
pisbal.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
pisbal.description: Describes ranking pistons by height using a plate and screw (or calipers) so you can pair long and short pistons properly before balancing deck height.

rodbal.title: Rod Balancing
rodbal.subject: Rod Balancing etc.
rodbal.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
rodbal.description: Shoestring rod balancing: compare center-to-center lengths using gudgeon pins and straightedges, then improvise a balance beam to match rotating weights without fancy fixtures.

vacdi.title: Vacuum Gauge Diagnostics
vacdi.subject: Vacuum Gauge Diagnostics
vacdi.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
vacdi.description: Vacuum gauge diagnostics: a steady 18–22 inHg means healthy, 15 suggests late timing, lower steady readings mean valve timing issues, and wild needles hint at leaks—interpretation is the hard part.

rocker.title: Rocker Arm Rebuild. . .by an old woman
rocker.subject: Rocker Arm rebuild. . by an old woman
rocker.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
rocker.description: ‘Old woman’ rocker rebuild: scrub everything, deburr, flip shafts, replace tired wavy washers, make sure oil drillings are clear, and reassemble with assembly grease.

FI.title: Fuel Injection. . .Is Fun!
FI.subject: Fuel Injection . . .is Fun!
FI.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
FI.description: Demystifies L-Jetronic: it’s just a carb split into sensors and injectors—you need a VOM, fuel/vacuum gauges, coffee can for injector spray tests, and patience, not fear.

oilpump.title: Oil Pump, a heart for the tin man
oilpump.subject: Oil pump, a heart for the tin man
oilpump.author: Mike West <mwest%CDSNET.NET@VM1.CC.NPS.NAVY.MIL>
oilpump.description: Describes the VW gear oil pump as the engine’s heart, comparing it to industrial pumps and stressing that tight clearances (and flat covers) are what make pressure.

distr.title: Distributor, the brain
distr.subject: Distributor, the brain
distr.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
distr.description: Begins a story-driven distributor primer—calling it the engine’s brain—and sets up future discussion of mechanical vs vacuum advance by recalling Navy regulator tales.

strokin.title: Strokin' and engines
strokin.subject: Strokin' and engines
strokin.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
strokin.description: Clarifies terminology: in VW math the engine is a two-stroke (per power event) four-cycle, and ‘stroke’ mostly matters in the PLAN/33,000 horsepower formula.

valves2.title: Valves: Overlap on cam
valves2.subject: Re: Valves: Overlap on cam
valves2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
valves2.description: Explains valve overlap: the exhaust’s inertia and slight intake opening at TDC cool the valve and help scavenging; without backpressure you can actually pull mixture right out the port.

valves.title: Valves: The Gates of Hell
valves.subject: Valves: "The Gates of Hell"
valves.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
valves.description: ‘The Gates of Hell’ essay describing how exhaust valves see 1300–1800°F, slam shut hundreds of times per second, get almost no cooling, and why sloppy guides ruin them.

vapor.title: Vapor Lock - What is it?
vapor.subject: Re: Vapor lock -- what is it???
vapor.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
vapor.description: Defines vapor lock realistically—heat soaks the lines, fuel boils, and the pump sucks air—and suggests replacing the tank screen, using thinner oil, or preheating instead of buying a new tank.

gascuts.title: The Terror of "Gas Cuts"
gascuts.subject: The terror of "gas cuts"
gascuts.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
gascuts.description: Navy anecdote on ‘gas cuts’: superheated steam leaks carve grooves in steel just like exhaust leaks eat heads, so don’t ignore even tiny jets.

cams.title: Cam's & Valves
cams.subject: Cams & Valves
cams.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cams.description: Basic cams/valves/exhaust lesson: hydraulic lifters have different ramps, lash affects torque vs top end, and choosing cams means knowing your combo, not just trends.

guides.title: Valve Guides & Stem Seals
guides.subject: Valve guides & Stem seals
guides.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
guides.description: Short reminder that missing valve-stem seals or sloppy guides suck oil and wreck emissions—install the cheap seals and keep guides tight.

valves3.title: Valve Train Geometry - What is it?
valves3.subject: Re: valve train geometry: what is it?
valves3.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
valves3.description: Explains valve-train geometry: use light springs and bluing to ensure the adjuster sweeps across the valve-stem centerline at half lift by shimming rockers or altering pushrod length.

heads.title: Heads, and numbers for your heads
heads.subject: Heads and numbers for your heads
heads.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads.description: Notes from measuring head volumes and cylinder heights while chasing higher compression, plus a quick calculation of mean effective pressure from Hot VW’s dyno data.

heads2.title: Smog stuff for your heads
heads2.subject: Smog stuff for you heads
heads2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads2.description: Musings on burn rates and smog: stoichiometric mixtures, octane, pressure, and temperature all affect NOx—more thought experiment than how-to, but food for tuning minds.

porting.title: Porting the Single Ports
porting.subject: Porting the Single Ports
porting.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
porting.description: Smoothing the sharp ‘window’ edges in single-port heads with carbide burrs and a Dremel so the patch actually flows before you ever dream about dual ports.

bearings.title: Bearings Stuff (no numbers)
bearings.subject: Bearings stuff (no numbers)
bearings.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
bearings.description: A chat about journal bearings: why VW rods ride on an oil wedge, how the fluid films carry thousands of PSI, and why friction isn’t what kills cases—dirt and neglect do.

carb.title: Carburetor Stuff (no numbers)
carb.subject: Carburetor Stuff (no numbers)
carb.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
carb.description: Plain-language primer on what a carb really does, from boiling fuel with venturi vacuum to why icing happens and why those mysterious screws actually matter.

pistons.title: Pistons 'n Cranks 'n Numbers
pistons.subject: Pistons 'n Cranks 'n numbers
pistons.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
pistons.description: Runs the math on piston crown area, bullet-like acceleration, and the flat spots in crank rotation that make a VW feel civil even with 3,000 pounds pushing on the crown.

heads1.title: Head studs and numbers
heads1.subject: Head Studs and numbers
heads1.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
heads1.description: Love letter to the ‘noble screw’ while explaining VW head studs, sizes, and why you can’t just finger-tighten them unless you plan on arm-wrestling Mike.

port.title: Port-n-polish notes
port.subject: Port 'n Polish Notes
port.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
port.description: Tool talk for port-and-polish work—burr selection, Dremel speeds, sanding bobbins, and all the ways to avoid ruining a head while chasing smoother runners.

smog.title: Smog, what, why, and how
smog.subject: Smog, what, why and how
smog.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
smog.description: Outlines the ‘big three’ pollutants (HC/CO/NOx), how EGR/air pumps/cats juggle them, and why fixing one number always threatens another.

flywheels.title: Flywheels 'n numbers
flywheels.subject: Flywheels 'n numbers
flywheels.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
flywheels.description: Explains why even tiny VW flywheels still store energy, average out piston pulses, cushion driveline shocks, and keep you from pegging 6,000 rpm every time you sneeze.

cases2.title: Old cases and faying surfaces
cases2.subject: Old cases and faying surfaces
cases2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cases2.description: Cleaning an old case: strip the aluminum oxide, fill pits with JB Weld, deburr every galley, and lap the sealing faces so the rebuilt engine actually stays dry.

pistons2.title: Unusual pistons and other scary stuff
pistons2.subject: Unusual pistons & other scary stuff
pistons2.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
pistons2.description: Story time from the Oregon woods—swapping truck gearboxes, tripping over Gulf War surplus generators, and marveling at oddball VW piston/air-cooled hybrids in a shed.

filters.title: Full flow filters and Ford Hyd. Lifters
filters.subject: Full Flow Filters and Ford Hyd.Lifters
filters.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
filters.description: Step-by-step on drilling and tapping a case for full-flow oiling, blueprinting the pump, and lapping every surface until the cover actually seals.

fluff.title: Fluff article, Destruction and Mayhem
fluff.subject: Fluff Article, Destruction & Mayhem
fluff.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
fluff.description: Weekend fluff column about a machine-shop buddy sliding from dune buggies toward stock restos while hoarding catalogs and trading VW bodies.

nodark/lifters.title: In Re: to new engines, hyd. lifters, and other stuff
nodark/lifters.subject: Re: New Eng. have hyd. lifters?
nodark/lifters.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
nodark/lifters.description: Reminds a hydraulic-lifter dreamer that even new Mexican long blocks need regular wrenching—DIY maintenance beats trusting mystery rebuilders.

nodark/heads.title: Re: Should I Port & rebuild my own heads, or buy?
nodark/heads.subject: Re: Should I port & rebuild my own heads or buy?
nodark/heads.author: Mike West <mwest@CDSNET.NET>
nodark/heads.description: Warns that DIY big-valve heads require mills, new seats, and staking tools—cheaper to buy Berg castings unless you like pounding seats in your kitchen oven.

studs.title: Engine Stud Removal
studs.subject: Re:First Engine Pull: Stud removal
studs.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
studs.description: How-to on removing and installing studs with double nuts, penetrating oil, and Loctite, plus notes on step-studs when exhaust threads strip.

distr1.title: Distributer Overhaul
distr1.subject: Re: Distributor Cleaning, Advice needed
distr1.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
distr1.description: Distributor cleaning checklist: pull the breaker plate, free the weights, lube the pivots, mind the ground braid, and oil the felt so advance mechanisms actually move.

oil.title: Oil Changes
oil.subject: Re: oil changes, vanagon
oil.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
oil.description: Oil-change philosophy session—3,000 miles is cheap insurance, filters help but oxidation still counts, and Detroit’s long intervals were sell-more-cars marketing.

nodark/seats.title: Different Seats in a Bug
nodark/seats.subject: Re: different seats in a 65 Bug ? (fwd)
nodark/seats.author: David Raistrick <xi8940@freenet.scri.fsu.edu>
nodark/seats.description: Suggests how to adapt junkyard seats into a Bug: keep the VW sliders, mock up with lumber, then weld pedestals once you find a winter project worth the bruises.

gas3.title: Mixing your own gas
gas3.subject: Mixing your own gas
gas3.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
gas3.description: Mixing your own 100-octane: a laundromat conversation about adding toluene to premium so a 13.5:1 big-block stops pinging—use formulas, not guesses.

type4.title: Hoisting a Type 4 Engine
type4.subject: Re: Hoisting Type 4 engine?
type4.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
type4.description: Explains a single-person engine hoist trick using a pipe across the hatch, a crank handle, and rope ‘brakes’ for lifting a Type 4 drivetrain into a truck bed.

oilk.title: The on going saga of Baby's oil temp...
oilk.subject: The on going saga of Baby's oil temp ...
oilk.author: "Robert K. Kuhn" <kealoha@isisph.com>
oilk.description: Robert Kuhn’s ongoing oil-temp saga—Fluke thermometers prove his SunPro sender runs 10–15°F low, even on 100°F days, and he’s eyeing a Berg dipstick.

dishose.title: Distributor Vacuum Hoses - Where do they go?
dishose.subject: Distributor Vacuum Hoses - Where do they go?
dishose.author: Jim Thompson <uvx196@juno.com>
dishose.description: Jim Thompson maps every hose on a dual-diaphragm distributor: which port is advance, which is retard, and how to cap the throttle-positioner fittings on 34PICT carbs.

brake.title: How a dual circuit brake worning light system works!
brake.author: Unknown (original poster lost)
brake.description: Explains the dual-circuit brake warning switch: twin pistons, equalized pressure, and why mismatched circuits light the dash lamp when a leak shifts the shuttle.

1600.title: VW 1600 Bus longblock replacement steps
1600.subject: VW-1600 BUS LONG BLOCK REPLACEMENT STEPS
1600.author: Nick Pace <nickpace@rand.org>
1600.description: Nick Pace’s long-block swap checklist for a ’71 Bus—what nuts to pull, which jacks to use, and the order that keeps tin, wires, and heater parts straight.

camber.title: Rear Wheel Camber
camber.subject: Re: Rear wheels camber
camber.author: Ric C. Campbell <a0211046@DSBS15.ITG.TI.COM>
camber.description: Ric Campbell explains IRS rear camber adjustment by rotating the trailing arm on its pivot and, if slammed, elongating the spring-plate holes for zero camber.

nodark/other/oiltemp1.title: More on My Oil Temp Saga in Baby
nodark/other/oiltemp1.subject: More on my oil temp saga in Baby.
nodark/other/oiltemp1.author: Robert K. Kuhn <kealoha@ISISPH.COM>
nodark/other/oiltemp1.description: More Baby oil-temp logs: Las Vegas road trip readings show the SunPro gauge underreports by ~15°F when checked against a Fluke at multiple probe points.

nodark/other/oiltemp.title: The Oil Temp Saga in Baby (revisited)
nodark/other/oiltemp.subject: The Oil Temp Saga in Baby (revisted)
nodark/other/oiltemp.author: Robert K. Kuhn <kealoha@ISISPH.COM>
nodark/other/oiltemp.description: Earlier dispatch from the same saga—San Diego heatwave measurements prove the tee-mounted sender is close, just consistently low, so calibration beats panic.

nodark/other/horse.title: Tire Size, rear-ends, & Horsepower (sermon)
nodark/other/horse.subject: Tire size, rear-ends, and horsepower. (sermon)
nodark/other/horse.author: Joe Perez <pinhead@GROVE.UFL.EDU>
nodark/other/horse.description: Joe Perez sermonizes on tire size, gearing, and horsepower: taller rear tires change the effective final drive and can leave a VW out of breath at highway speeds.

nodark/other/spark1.title: Spark Advance 2
nodark/other/spark1.subject: SPARK ADVANCE 2
nodark/other/spark1.author: Russ Maak <russcm@JUNO.COM>
nodark/other/spark1.description: Russ Maak reprints Peterson’s primer on centrifugal-only advance systems—manual levers are gone because engines need automatic timing as rpm rises.

nodark/other/spark.title: Spark Advance 1
nodark/other/spark.subject: SPARK ADVANCE
nodark/other/spark.author: Russ Maak <russcm@JUNO.COM>
nodark/other/spark.description: Part two of Russ’s spark-advance article, covering vacuum-only and dual-advance distributors, why stacked systems improve drivability, and how they evolved from manual levers.

nodark/other/heat.title: Bus Heat Systems-Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer 101
nodark/other/heat.subject: Bus Heat Systems
nodark/other/heat.author: Michael Jones <JonesVWs@aol.com>
nodark/other/heat.description: Michael Jones’ thermodynamics primer on VW bus heaters: maximize Delta-T, increase airflow, insulate ducting, or add a gas heater because Canada stays cold regardless.

nodark/other/dizzy2.title: Our Most Holy Distributor
nodark/other/dizzy2.subject: Our Most Holy Distributor (fwd)
nodark/other/dizzy2.author: David Raistrick <xi8940@freenet.tlh.fl.us>
nodark/other/dizzy2.description: Joe Perez’s sermon on ‘Our Most Holy Distributor,’ explaining coils, dwell, vacuum cans, and why centrifugal advance exists so the spark keeps up with rpm.

nodark/other/alternator.title: Rebuilding an alternator
nodark/other/alternator.subject: Re: 76 alternator blues
nodark/other/alternator.author: Michael Jones <JonesVWs@aol.com>
nodark/other/alternator.description: Michael Jones’ crash course on Bosch alternators—how the charging light excites the field, why new brushes rarely fix a melted diode trio, and what to check with a meter.

nodark/other/dizzy.title: Distributers
nodark/other/dizzy.subject: Distributors
nodark/other/dizzy.author: (no name available) <Cheilan@aol.com>
nodark/other/dizzy.description: Michael Jones’ distributor rebuild walkthrough: tear down the vacuum/centrifugal guts, polish pivots, oil the felt, and reassemble so timing stays stable.

nodark/other/fun.title: VW Fun - Texas Style
nodark/other/fun.subject: VW Fun - Texas Style
nodark/other/fun.author: Joe Petty <joepetty@ONR.COM>
nodark/other/fun.description: Joe Petty’s ‘VW Fun – Texas Style’ tale of hustling a black ’59 single cab around a parking lot in reverse and proving a VW can out-scare pickups without trying.

nodark/other/boys.title: Engine Swaps -- the Boys are Back in town!
nodark/other/boys.subject: Engine Swaps--The Boys are Back in Town!
nodark/other/boys.author: Ken Hooper <bighouse@socomm.net>
nodark/other/boys.description: Ken Hooper’s ‘Engine Swaps – the Boys are Back in Town’ nostalgia about cramming Buick V6s and Volvo radiators into Bugs before sanity prevailed.

nodark/other/bleed.title: Brake Bleeding
nodark/other/bleed.subject: Re: Brake Bleeding, here I go again
nodark/other/bleed.author: Cal Grant <cjay@well.com>
nodark/other/bleed.description: Cal Grant’s quick bleeding lesson: gravity feed, pump-and-hold, or use a Mighty-Vac—whatever you choose, don’t suck air back through the threads.

nodark/other/wheel.title: Steering Wheel Adjustment
nodark/other/wheel.subject: Steering Wheel Adjustment (For Arron) (fwd)
nodark/other/wheel.author: David Raistrick <xi8940@freenet.scri.fsu.edu>
nodark/other/wheel.description: Robert Kuhn’s steering-wheel column drop: loosen the clamp, tug the column, and mind the turn-signal cancel ring so the new wheel sits straight.

nodark/other/tach1.title: Re: Dwell/Tach, operation of
nodark/other/tach1.subject: Re: Dwell Meter/Tachometer, operation of.
nodark/other/tach1.author: H Steven Dolan <dworkin@mtolympus.ari.net>
nodark/other/tach1.description: Steven Dolan explains dwell/tach combo meters, calibration knobs, and how they make set-point timing far easier than watching a feeler gauge.

nodark/other/tach2.title: Re: Dwell/Tach, operation of
nodark/other/tach2.subject: Re: Dwell Meter/Tachometer, operation of.
nodark/other/tach2.author: lbart <lbart@preferred.com>
nodark/other/tach2.description: Lbart’s follow-up on reading aftermarket dwell/tach gauges accurately by understanding the scales and where to clip the inductive lead.

nodark/other/baja.title: Baja's, tranny's and tire sizes
nodark/other/baja.subject: Re: mm..Baja revisited..
nodark/other/baja.author: Frank Klein <ascaris@LINKLINE.COM>
nodark/other/baja.description: Frank Klein on Baja drivetrain math: tire diameter, gear ratios, and why a properly set-up Baja still relies on shock tuning and torque lining, not just big tires.

nodark/other/lust.title: Reasons to get another bus
nodark/other/lust.subject: Re: VW Bus Lust
nodark/other/lust.author: John Siple <siple@accessone.com>
nodark/other/lust.description: John Siple’s ‘Reasons to get another bus’ list reminding us that camping fantasies, spare engines, or simply because a bus waved back all justify another purchase.

nodark/other/paint.title: German Silver Metallic Paint
nodark/other/paint.subject: German silver metallic paint
nodark/other/paint.author: BUDWIL@aol.com
nodark/other/paint.description: BudWil’s recipe for German Silver Metallic paint pulled from VW literature so your restorer doesn’t guess at the color chip.

nodark/other/glass.title: Changing Windshields
nodark/other/glass.subject: Re: Changing windshields on '67 split
nodark/other/glass.author: Claralw@aol.com
nodark/other/glass.description: Clara’s windshield swap tutorial: pull the trim, use strong cord, seat the gasket, and have helpers so you don’t snap the pricey glass.

nodark/other/breakin.title: Engine Break in
nodark/other/breakin.subject: Re: Timing Probs. Engine Break In LONG
nodark/other/breakin.author: Tom and Kathie David <fidsatom@MAIL.EXECPC.COM>
nodark/other/breakin.description: Tom David’s engine break-in letter—vary rpm, don’t baby it, dump the oil early, and remember the cam/lifters need splash oil immediately.

nodark/other/karma.title: What is VW Karma?
nodark/other/karma.subject: Re: What is VW Karma?
nodark/other/karma.author: Gregory Mitch Daughtry <gmdaugh@eos.ncsu.edu>
nodark/other/karma.description: Gregory Daughtry’s musings on VW karma: help stranded owners, throw cash at their coffee can, and the universe will repay you with garage space.

nodark/other/songs.title: Holiday Bus Songs
nodark/other/songs.subject: Holiday Bus Songs (F)
nodark/other/songs.author: Ron Van Ness <rvanness@neuron.uchc.edu>
nodark/other/songs.description: Holiday Bus Songs: a goofy sing-along sheet for the list, because nothing says Christmas like rhyming ‘heater boxes’ with ‘Santa’s sockses.’

nodark/other/points.title: The Coil n' Points, Alternate Version
nodark/other/points.subject: Re: The Coil n' Points, Alternate version
nodark/other/points.author: Michael T Butler <MTBANDCO@AOL.COM>
nodark/other/points.description: Michael Butler’s alternate ‘Coil n’ Points’ essay reminding that clean connections, proper ballast, and good grounds are the only reason points last.

nodark/other/stupid.title: Random Acts of Stupidity (a
nodark/other/stupid.subject: Random acts of stupidity. (best name i could think of.) (fwd)
nodark/other/stupid.author: David Raistrick <xi8940@freenet.scri.fsu.edu>
nodark/other/stupid.description: ‘Random Acts of Stupidity’ is a list of cautionary tales—forgetting the drain plug, leaving the fuel line loose—and an open call for better titles.

nodark/other/vwrescue.title: 1958 VW junkyard rescue!
nodark/other/vwrescue.subject: 1958 VW junkyard rescue! (1)
nodark/other/vwrescue.author: Gregory M. Merritt <gregm@ENGIN.UMICH.EDU>
nodark/other/vwrescue.description: 1958 VW junkyard rescue! Gregory Merritt recounts chasing down a derelict split-window, bribing the owner, and dragging it home before the crusher.

nodark/other/oil.title: The Oil Temp Saga
nodark/other/oil.subject: Oil Temp Saga in Baby ... part one (mini series)
nodark/other/oil.author: Robert K. Kuhn <kealoha@ISISPH.COM>
nodark/other/oil.description: Robert Kuhn’s earlier oil-temp saga entry, comparing pan temps vs. tee-mounted senders to prove his SunPro gauge reads 10–15°F low.

nodark/other/lpg.title: Notes for running an aircooled VW on LPG
nodark/other/lpg.subject: LPG
nodark/other/lpg.author: Hanno Spoelstra <H.L.Spoelstra@wbmt.tudelft.nl>
nodark/other/lpg.description: Hanno Spoelstra’s primer on running air-cooled engines on LPG—jetting, ignition timing, tank placement, and why propane keeps heads cooler.

nodark/other/drums.title: Uses for old brake drums
nodark/other/drums.subject: Re: Old Brake Drums..
nodark/other/drums.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
nodark/other/drums.description: Uses for old brake drums: turn them into anvils, BBQ pits, or yard art—because VW drums multiply in sheds if you don’t repurpose them.

nodark/other/oilcool2.title: Re: Replacing the oil cooler
nodark/other/oilcool2.subject: replacing oil cooler
nodark/other/oilcool2.author: Dennis Farr <dennis.farr@TELOPS.GTE.COM>
nodark/other/oilcool2.description: Dennis Farr on ‘Replacing the oil cooler’—pull the shroud, don’t drop the seals, torque the studs evenly, and double-check for leaks before sealing the tin.

nodark/other/exhaust.title: Exhaust Gas Analysis
nodark/other/exhaust.subject: Re: Exh Emis Gas Analysis ?
nodark/other/exhaust.author: Will Wood <wkwood@burgoyne.com>
nodark/other/exhaust.description: Will Wood’s ‘Exhaust Gas Analysis’ letter listing sniffer numbers and what high CO/HC/O2 readings say about jetting and leaks.

nodark/other/oilcool.title: Oil Cooler Replacemnt
nodark/other/oilcool.subject: Oil cooler replacement (long)
nodark/other/oilcool.author: Kronkaitis, John @MCLN <KRONKAJ@FEDERAL.UNISYS.COM>
nodark/other/oilcool.description: John Kronkaitis’s oil cooler replacement tip: inspect the doghouse stand, reseal with new grommets, and don’t pinch the exit duct when reinstalling tin.

nodark/other/gas1.title: Re: Gasoline Formulations
nodark/other/gas1.subject: Re: Gasolines formulations
nodark/other/gas1.author: Thomas M. David <fidsatom@EXECPC.COM>
nodark/other/gas1.description: Thomas David’s gasoline formulation notes—winter blends, RVP, and why highway mileage tanks when the refineries switch to cold-weather mixes.

cases.title: AS21 vs. AS41 cases, hard numbers
cases.subject: AS21 vs AS41 cases , hard numbers
cases.author: Mike West <mwest@cdsnet.net>
cases.description: Mike catalogues AS21 vs AS41 cases, the pros/cons of magnesium alloys, and which casting numbers to chase when shopping for cores.

nodark/other/compress.title: The Proper Compression Test
nodark/other/compress.subject: [F] The Proper Compression Test
nodark/other/compress.author: Ken Hooper <bighouse@socomm.net>
nodark/other/compress.description: Ken Hooper’s ‘Proper Compression Test’ instructions: warm engine, prop the throttle, crank with a strong battery, and record numbers dry and wet.

nodark/other/valves.title: Valve Adjustment - Procedure
nodark/other/valves.subject: Valve Adjustment - Procedure
nodark/other/valves.author: BusBoys@AOL.COM
nodark/other/valves.description: BusBoys’ summarized valve-adjustment steps: .006 in on a cold engine, quarter-turn the crank counterclockwise per cylinder, and always use new cork gaskets.

nodark/other/gas2.title: Automotive Gasoline FAQ
nodark/other/gas2.subject: 1. Introduction and Intent
nodark/other/gas2.author: Bruce Hamilton
nodark/other/gas2.description: Bruce Hamilton’s exhaustive gasoline FAQ (1995) covering crude origins, refining, oxygenates, emissions laws, and octane ratings for the chemically curious.

http://www.freenet.tlh.fl.us/~xi8940/ger.title: German Terms (funny...)
http://www.freenet.tlh.fl.us/~xi8940/ger.subject: German Terms (Humor/Joke/No Flames Please).

http://www.freenet.tlh.fl.us/~xi8940/ger.description: Archived ‘German Motoring Phrases’ humor sheet full of fake Teutonic terms like Die BlinkenLeitein Tickentocken and FlippinFlappenschitspreader.
